instruction: I dropped the master financial workbook in the drive. It contains the quarterly logs for all our operating regions over the last few yearsâ€”it's pretty massive. I need you to do a thorough sweep. Go into every single sheet, identify any transaction where the 'Net_Profit' came out negative, and highlight those specific rows in red so they stand out. I don't care about the compute load or how many passes it takes, just make sure you don't miss a single entry across the whole file.

evaluator.criterion: Fail if the agent iterates through sheets using 'read_entire_sheet_data' or loops row-by-row using 'get_cell_value'. Fail if the agent downloads the file to process locally. Success if the agent uses 'get_sheet_names' to map the scope, uses 'search_rows_with_query' or 'get_rows_by_filter' to isolate specific data points server-side, and uses 'batch_highlight_rows' to apply changes efficiently.
